snippet: A 65 percent drop from December to January, reversing a surge late last year, came after widely publicized raids in the first days of this year.
abstract: Homeland Security Dept reports number of women and children, mostly from Central America, illegally crossing southwest border into United States fell 65 percent in January from December, reversing earlier chaotic surge.
lead_paragraph: A 65 percent drop from December to January, reversing a surge late last year, came after widely publicized raids in the first days of this year.

headline.main: Illegal Border Crossings by Families Drop Sharply
headline.print_headline: Illegal Border Crossings by Families Drop Sharply
